segments.text: I notice the boy on the stool, reaching for the cookie jar like he’s on a mission.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The stool looks like it’s about to tip, and I’m terrified he’s going to fall.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: His sister is right there, waiting for a cookie, but she doesn’t seem to care about the danger.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe how reckless they’re being, especially with the water all over the floor.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is stretching so far, and the stool is wobbling—I think he’s going to crash any second.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is just standing there, like this is totally normal.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if they’ve done this before and gotten away with it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is right there, but she’s completely clueless about what’s happening behind her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t help but laugh at how absurd this whole situation is.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope someone stops them before something bad happens.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This is like watching a slow-motion accident, and no one is doing anything about it.
segments.speaker: PAR
